item.title: Overview
item.description: High Availability # JobManager High Availability (HA) hardens a Flink cluster against JobManager failures. This feature ensures that a Flink cluster will always continue executing your submitted jobs. JobManager High Availability # The JobManager coordinates every Flink deployment. It is responsible for both scheduling and resource management. By default, there is a single JobManager instance per Flink cluster. This creates a single point of failure (SPOF): if the JobManager crashes, no new programs can be submitted and running programs fail.

item.title: ZooKeeper HA Services
item.description: ZooKeeper HA Services # Flink’s ZooKeeper HA services use ZooKeeper for high availability services. Flink leverages ZooKeeper for distributed coordination between all running JobManager instances. ZooKeeper is a separate service from Flink, which provides highly reliable distributed coordination via leader election and light-weight consistent state storage. Check out ZooKeeper’s Getting Started Guide for more information about ZooKeeper. Flink includes scripts to bootstrap a simple ZooKeeper installation. item.title: Kubernetes HA Services
item.description: Kubernetes HA Services # Flink’s Kubernetes HA services use Kubernetes for high availability services. Kubernetes high availability services can only be used when deploying to Kubernetes.
